Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk abrt
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: abrt, libreport, and satyr bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The Automatic Bug Reporting Tool (ABRT) is a tool to help users to detect defects in applications and to create bug reports with all information needed by maintainers to fix the defects. It uses a plug-in system to extend its functionality. The libreport libraries provide APIs for reporting different problems in applications to different bug targets like Bugzilla, FTP, or Trac. Satyr is a library that can be used to create and process microreports. Microreports consist of structured data suitable to be analyzed in a fully automated manner, though they do not necessarily contain sufficient information to fix the underlying problem. The reports are designed not to contain any potentially sensitive data to eliminate the need for review before submission. Included is a tool that can create microreports and perform some basic operations on them. This update fixes the following bug: Previously, ABRT created a new problem for every machine check event causing some systems to generate many non-fatal machine check exceptions (MCEs), for example fan problems. Consequently, ABRT ran SOS upon creation of each new problem. To allow users to eliminate this behavior on systems generating numerous MCEs, a new configuration option called OnlyFatalMCE has been introduced to disable detection of non-fatal MCEs. If this option is enabled, ABRT no longer runs SOS for corrected machine check events. (BZ#1076820) In addition, this update adds the following enhancements: A convenient way of handling a large number of problems detected at login to the system. The enhancement introduces the "process" command line argument in the Automatic Bug Reporting Tool (ABRT) command line interface (abrt-cli). The argument enables the user to process all detected problems at one time by using a single command. (BZ#1066482) Workflows that enable straightforward reporting for the logger, mailx, and reportuploader plug-ins are now available. The workflow definitions added for all installed plug-ins are by default disabled. (BZ#1094203) Users are now able to correct typos in credentials upon authentication failures when logging into the portal. (BZ#1104313) Targeted notifications for systems administrators are now enabled. The ABRT server is capable of sending e-mail notifications to customers with information about what bug fixes should be applied to specific machines. (BZ#1139552, BZ#1139557) ABRT server now provides a way of notifying systems administrators about fixes to their problems by sending them information on bug fixes. (BZ#1150389) The abrt-auto-reporting command line tool now provides a convenient way to configure the micro-reporting feature. The tool enables turning auto-reporting on or off, and configuring authentication for micro‑reporting. (BZ#1174833) Users of abrt, libreport, and satyr are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix this bug and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
